intro: Aureolaria grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, providing some drought tolerance, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Aureolaria grandiflora is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
